ProcedureHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROC STANDARD <option(s)>;
    
The STANDARD procedure standardizes variables in a SAS data set to a given mean and 
standard deviation, and it creates a new SAS data set containing the standardized 
values.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DATA=SAS-data-set] 
      
Identifies the input SAS data set.
Excludes observations with nonpositive weight values (zero or negative).
Suppresses the printing of the procedure output. NOPRINT is the default value.

[Syntax: MEAN=mean-value] 
      
Standardizes variables to a mean of mean-value.

[Syntax: OUT=SAS-data-set] 
      
Identifies the output data set.
Prints the original frequency, mean, and standard deviation for each variable to standardize.
Replaces missing values with the variable mean.

[Syntax: STD=std-value] 
      
Standardizes variables to a standard deviation of std-value.
Specifies the divisor to use in the calculation of variances and standard deviation.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: BY <DESCENDING> variable-1 <...<DESCENDING> variable-n> <NOTSORTED>; 
      
Calculates standardized values separately for each BY group.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that 
immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.
Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: FREQ variable;] 
      
Specifies a numeric variable whose values represent the frequency of the observation.

[Syntax: VAR variable(s);] 
      
Specifies the variables to standardize and their order in the printed output.

Syntax: WEIGHT variable;
      
Specifies weights for analysis variables in the statistical calculations.
